42c027e4ff9730fbb3de84c1af0d2c506e41c3e4: Daniel Radcliffe gains access to £20 million fortune as he turns 18. He insists he won't be extravagant with his money. Radcliffe plans to keep his feet firmly on the ground despite his growing fame and riches.
ee8871b15c50d0db17b0179a6d2beab35065f1e9:
Miami-Dade jail houses mentally ill inmates on "forgotten floor."
Judge advocates for long-term treatment over punishment for mentally ill inmates.
Leifman works to change system, redirect inmates to mental health facility.
State saves money and provides relief for families with new approach.
06352019a19ae31e527f37f7571c6dd7f0c5da37:
Drivers describe harrowing tales of survival after Minneapolis bridge collapse.
Rescuers, including volunteers and EMTs, worked feverishly to help victims.
Survivors recount free falls, chaos, and disbelief at being alive.
24521a2abb2e1f5e34e6824e0f9e56904a2b0e88: Doctors removed five small polyps from President Bush's colon, none appeared worrisome. Results expected in two to three days. Bush in good humor, will resume activities at Camp David. Vice President Cheney assumed presidential power during the procedure.
7fe70cc8b12fab2d0a258fababf7d9c6b5e1262a: NFL suspends Michael Vick indefinitely without pay for dogfighting involvement. Vick set to appear in court Monday for plea deal. Vick admits to participating in dogfighting ring and killing dogs. Goodell to review suspension after legal proceedings.
a1ebb8bb4d370a1fdf28769206d572be60642d70:
5-year-old Youssif, a burn victim, receives support from around the world.
The Children's Burn Foundation will cover his medical costs and treatment in the US.
His family faces security risks in Iraq but has new hope.
7c0e61ac829a3b3b653e2e3e7536cc4881d1f264:
Iraqi women turn to prostitution to survive due to violence and poverty.
Many women feel forced into prostitution to provide for their children.
Humanitarian workers are trying to help these women and bring attention to their plight.
f0d73bdab711763e745cdc75850861c9018f235d:
Key FARC commander "El Negro Acacio" killed in Colombian military air attack.
Medina Caracas managed FARC's cocaine trafficking network, targeted by U.S. Justice Department.
Army's Rapid Response Force tracked down Medina Caracas at FARC camp in the jungle.
14 dead rebels found at the camp, Defense Minister Juan Manuel Santos confirmed.
5e22bbfc7232418b8d2dd646b952e404df5bd048: White House press secretary Tony Snow will step down on September 14. President Bush praised Snow's contributions and battle with cancer. Snow plans to leave to earn more money and continue speaking out on issues. Snow's health is improving, with stable tumors and no new growths.
613d6311ec2c1985bd44707d1796d275452fe156:
Empty rocket launcher tube found on Jersey City lawn, deemed not a public safety hazard.
Investigation underway by FBI and police to determine origin and circumstances.
Device identified as a 20-year-old AT4 anti-tank rocket launcher tube.
017d27d00eb43678c15cb4a8dd4723a035323219:
President Bush invokes historical lessons of Vietnam to argue against pulling out of Iraq.
Bush will tell Veterans of Foreign Wars that withdrawing from Vietnam emboldened today's terrorists.
White House attempts to reframe the debate over Iraq as public support for the war sags.
Bush's analogy to Vietnam and other historical comparisons from Asia will be included in his speech.
85f55a3e0dd672857aaaaa80954934a57b7a2fbf: Bombings and attempted attacks in the UK since the 1970s. Various incidents in London and other parts of England. IRA and Al Qaeda involvement in some attacks. Significant casualties and property damage in multiple incidents.
77d7c8cf2a9432e395d629371a12790c563c19f7:
Carlos Alberto joins Werder Bremen for record fee.
He aims to win titles with his new club.
He started his career with Fluminense and had success at FC Porto.
35f0e33de7923036a97ac245d899f990bda5e242: Vice President Cheney to serve as acting president during Bush's colonoscopy. Bush's last colonoscopy in 2002 found no abnormalities. Procedure to be supervised by Dr. Richard Tubb at Camp David. Small polyps may be removed during the colonoscopy.
2ad31cae96512af5105b9b23f9b681dc732b2605: Magnitude 4.2 earthquake hits San Francisco area, leaving 2,000 without power. USGS classifies quake as "light," causing minimal damage. Quake centered two miles east-northeast of Oakland, shaking lasting about 50 seconds.
0d43b97000ff852282c89d8d105e41495c0ee9bd:
"Hope lost" for trapped Utah miners, says federal official.
Rescue efforts exhausted, no signs of life found.
President Bush and Labor Secretary express sympathy for families.
Mine owner plans to permanently close and seal mine.
bf0cd4ccacd4fe045995338f4c44d9cf18000226: At least 14 killed, 60 wounded in bombing at Algeria president's event. Explosion occurred near mosque in Batna, east of Algiers. No immediate claim of responsibility for the attack. President Bouteflika visited wounded before returning to capital.
2f43e9dfaa43ffbddbce339a8b6403ddce43b38a:
David Beckham joins U.S. Major League Soccer's Los Angeles Galaxy team.
CNN explores Beckham's rise to fame and his impact on U.S. soccer.
Beckham and family face challenges adapting to life in Los Angeles.
The perception of soccer in the U.S. is changing, with more kids choosing the European game.
eb68bc51ed4fc727a1af058192a3fef0916c91e7:
Australian honey bees may be linked to U.S. honey bee colony collapse.
Israeli Acute Paralysis Virus (IAPV) found in healthy Australian bees.
Colony collapse disorder likely caused by multiple factors, not just IAPV.
Researchers are investigating genetic resistance and other stressors affecting bees.
ad021a7924ee57491cee8576499ac196b1afeb23: Savers lined up to empty accounts at UK mortgage bank. Customers withdrew about £1 billion since bank's woes revealed. Bank reassures customers, government steps in to stabilize banking system. Northern Rock CEO says emergency cash not yet used.
9d7fc7fd9ffbfecb1c458b9929fa02e6c3538368:
O.J. Simpson held without bail after robbery and assault charges.
Accused of directing armed robbery of sports memorabilia in Las Vegas hotel.
No firearms found on Simpson, but firearms were used in the robbery.
Simpson faces prospect of another prosecution, more than a decade after murder trial.
30cb674030b01014d2c87b92f09152857e249631: Nigeria's TV survival show suspended after contestant drowns in preparation. Contestant Anthony Ogadje, 25, drowned in Shere Hills Lake. Show offers cash prize and celebrity status.
d41dc7fc05273a37f0aceaf4f3e35a187f12653e: Former government contract employee indicted for stealing nuclear materials in Tennessee. Materials were taken from East Tennessee Technology Park. The employee allegedly attempted to sell the materials to a French agent. The materials posed no threat to people but were meant for uranium enrichment.
fbc6a4d0697b2a3e8b549dcb1f80a8ce7bf47e34:
Chelsea waits on John Terry's fitness for Champions League match.
Frank Lampard ruled out due to injury.
Michael Essien expected to play despite leg injury.
0753a471e6908c35bcbc2daa37e21f3a8443b590:
Foreigners travel to poor countries for organ transplants due to shortage in rich countries.
Organ trafficking and black market for organs are on the rise.
China, Pakistan, Turkey, Egypt, Colombia, and the Philippines are popular destinations for organ transplants.
Lack of transparency and little protection for donors has led to calls for regulation.
08450c1bc03472825196be1acb02ac0e13bef939:
Lindsay Lohan's legal troubles raise questions about insurability for future movies.
Insurance experts say no actor is uninsurable, but costs may be high.
Industry has dealt with similar situations, but terms for covering Lohan would likely be serious.
Insurance rates for errant actors can range from 1 to 3 percent of a movie's production budget.
7fa8d9beca50155fd3d71a9087a4311ce321c34b: Francesco Totti threatens to quit Italian Players Association over Serie A start date. Totti complains Italian players are never listened to. Italian Football League ignored request to start season earlier for Euro 2008 qualifiers. Serie A start date set for August 26, despite coach's request for earlier start.
414a5b8ecbe189d2767c75b839775a1dcafaf4d3:
Blackwater denies involvement in unlawful arms activities in Iraq.
Federal prosecutors are investigating allegations of illegal weapons purchases by Blackwater employees.
The company claims to have no knowledge of improper weapon exports.
Blackwater resumed normal security operations in Iraq after a brief hiatus.
cac7a712935380d74410a7cba8d406235d51249a:
5-year-old burned Iraqi boy meets his favorite superhero, Spider-Man, at Universal Studios.
The boy enjoys being a child again, playing with SpongeBob and riding a tram.
His family finds happiness and peace in the generosity of America.
e9093ca0a82f2aba28cd2762942c04177cfbb000: Marine convicted in death of Iraqi civilian sentenced to reduction in rank and discharge. Cpl. Trent D. Thomas found guilty of kidnapping and conspiracy. Thomas demoted to entry-level private and receives bad-conduct discharge. Marines accused in case were members of Kilo Company, 3rd Battalion, 5th Marine Regiment.
55a6aabd120f0b18297f7efe22452f9b3aca0d8d:
Prince Harry pays tribute to Princess Diana on 10th anniversary of her death.
He describes her as "the best mother in the world" in a moving speech.
The Bishop of London also praises Diana's public work and compassion.
The memorial service marks a point to let her rest in peace.
06bc2f0272d033b123e9eebbb221c62d7d51c283: French Foreign Minister Bernard Kouchner challenges convention and authority. He supports US-led intervention in Iraq based on human rights. Kouchner warns Iran to "get serious" about its nuclear program. France under President Sarkozy aims to reclaim a role in top diplomatic tables.
17e43e8e7d2bbbb237df78537d108c3fa917d9fb:
- Beethoven's "Für Elise" may have been written for Therese Malfatti.
- Elton John's "Philadelphia Freedom" was a thank-you to Billie Jean King.
- The Kinks' "Lola" was inspired by a transvestite, possibly Candy Darling.
- "867-5309/Jenny" continues to receive crank calls despite its mystery origin.
ddcdeb9bdd19fa23f9495c85d48eeee910f33102:
Historic spending expected for political and issue-advocacy advertising in 2008 election cycle.
Cost could exceed $3 billion, nearly twice as much as 2004.
Interest groups have spent $6.2 million on TV ads for state and local ballot measures.
CMAG predicts over $800 million will be spent on TV ads in the battle for the White House.
ee0ba7928d8987f2cb21c9a2012a76730f77de45: Relatives arrive in Phuket to identify plane crash victims. Most victims were foreign nationals, including Americans and British. Investigation into crash continues, with weather conditions suspected as a factor. Low-cost airline's safety practices questioned following crash.
554fd99f28ae12472c5d99ef6383bb184744c25a:
Michael Moore and CNN's Sanjay Gupta argued over "Sicko" facts.
Both agreed on problems in America's health-care system.
Gupta criticized Moore for suggesting health care in other countries is free.
Moore opposed putting health care in the hands of the Bush administration.
9e141ebc1c06d483bf85f4e5c8b3c7bc2d00ea2f:
Some Democrats are reconsidering a resolution on Armenian genocide.
Turkey threatened to block U.S. access to Incirlik Air Base.
Pentagon preparing new supply routes for troops in Iraq.
Democratic leaders urging Pelosi to reconsider the resolution.
c9160e2f5ce386dabb10517e7a5c0933c01a9546: Twelve-year-old Mohammed Rasoul, who lost his leg in a bombing, is heading to the United States for treatment. An American charity has arranged for surgery and treatment at a hospital in Philadelphia. Mohammed hopes to rebuild Falluja and become an architect.
d256aee1a47eb5b489dee6fb72ab7f7d1483a37f:
India elects first female president, Pratibha Patil, in historic victory.
Supporters hope her presidency will bring attention to women's issues in India.
Patil won about two thirds of the electoral college votes, with strong support from ruling coalition.
Her victory comes despite a bitter campaign marked by scandal and controversy.
2fff2bc541ef34a6647dfa2e4294cdcc187e47b9:
More than 100 homes evacuated in San Diego landslide.
Mayor declares state of emergency, seeks aid from California and federal government.
Residents allowed to return to some houses, but damage reported.
677375a4c69e81ab623af7c06a6b0a8d03d6350e:
French charity attempted to take children from Chad for adoption.
Most children are not Sudanese or orphans, according to aid agencies.
Charity workers and journalists have been charged with kidnapping and extortion.
Chadian authorities accused the charity of kidnapping and concealing children's identities.
33530f97118cc905b05cb920671492c7bfdf3a3b:
Explorer discovers new island near Greenland, revealing impact of climate change.
Global warming experts warn of catastrophic consequences if unchecked.
Debate continues over human contribution to warming trend and its implications.
Uncertainties remain about future climate predictions and potential impacts.
3c19a753303ae0d67b3ae28e070c0f4157ffc52d:
Enraged crowd drags Ethiopian soldier's body through streets of Mogadishu.
Gun battles with Islamic insurgents kill 19 people in Somalia's capital.
Ethiopian troops clash with insurgents, driving hundreds from their homes.
Tensions escalate in Somalia as fighting continues between government forces and insurgents.
9313988d26672c576f08e130c895edf20d8aa626:
Stacy Peterson's disappearance now treated as potential homicide, husband a suspect.
Judge orders exhumation of Drew Peterson's third wife's body.
New information raises questions about third wife's death ruled as accident.
72f4a6670ec7ec915c83d58bb0ebf152b1605bb6: Julia Vakulenko will face Lindsay Davenport in her first WTA Tour final. Vakulenko seeks her first victory on the WTA Tour. Davenport is seeking her second win in three tournaments since returning from a one-year hiatus.
b73f50e29d5b2943eb315643bef8ee4e09f5605b: Pakistani President Musharraf declared a state of emergency and ordered arrests. The Supreme Court declared the state of emergency illegal. The U.S. does not support Musharraf's actions. Musharraf's administration is struggling to contain Islamic militancy.
f9689fb9656132e1c6d186851563f2b968643791: Chief operating officer of National Children's Museum arrested for distributing child pornography. Accused of sending images to undercover detective posing as mother and daughter. Museum officials "horrified" by news, Singer suspended from post. Singer faces up to 140 years in prison if convicted.
63831b842812b1a3d05b04904a10d160fe7ad2af: Chester Arthur Stiles appeared in court on charges of raping a 2-year-old girl. The total charges against him are 23 felony counts. The girl's mother expressed relief at Stiles' arrest and plans to testify against him. Stiles' former girlfriends also spoke out about the case.
05688bac0e46542be65a6df240428a6f26c86fd0: South African bowler Dale Steyn took a career-best 5-34 against New Zealand. South Africa leads by 287 runs after Hashim Amla and Jacques Kallis's unbeaten stand. New Zealand were bowled out for 118 in reply to South Africa's 226. Steyn's figures bettered his previous best of 5-47 against the same opponents.
5ba0d22ccba29ac8a3c77da069165d6016f5a214: Enjoy summer with hammocks, firefly catching, beach running, and espadrille tying.
